subject: Re: [junit] junit test + iterating over text records
msgSnippet: ... Google JUnit parameterized test case . If that doesn t help, tell us why and we ll try to find another solution with you. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
zimske wrote:

> I'm new with junit testing, and was wondering if anyone would have a
> suggestion about this... I have a test case of 6 test methods. As I
> figured so far, each test method invokes setUp and tearDown methods
> once. In setUp method I defined some user parameters (USER_ID, and
> such...) which are then passed to the test methods. I get these
> parameters from file and then put them into an arraylist (which is not
> entirely necessary, but hey...). What I need to know if there is a
> simple way of passing the same USER_ID to all the test methods, and -
> after all the methods have been executed - to pass the next USER_ID,
> and so forth... Basically, one USER_ID per test case execution/iteration.

Google "JUnit parameterized test case". If that doesn't help, tell us
why and we'll try to find another solution with you.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
